member.name: T:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader
member.summary: The main class for using compute shader class (Direct3D 11)

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Int32,ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags)
member.summary: Creates a compute shader class
member.param: The byte code of the compiled shader
The adapter (gpu) index. default: 0

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags)
member.summary: Creates a compute shader class
member.param: The path to the compute shader (relative to the solution this code is in)
The main kernel function of the shader
The type and version of the shader. default = cs_4_0. The type and version of the shader. default = cs_5_0. (cs is for Compute shader) (5_0 is for shader model 5.0)
The adapter (gpu) index. default: 0

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a compute shader and connect it to the device (from the device native pointer)
member.param: The byte code of the compiled shader
The native pointer for a Direct3D 11 device

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateTexture2D(System.Int32,System.Int32,ComputeShaders.TextureFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new texture connected to this compute shader (sharing the same Direct3D 11 device)
member.param: The width of the texture
The height of the texture
the format of the texture
Determines whether the created texture can be shared, if true then CSTexture2D.Share() can be called

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateTexture2D(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new texture (connected to this compute shader) having the bitmap information
member.param: The bitmap
Determines whether the created texture can be shared, if true then CSTexture2D.Share() can be called

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateTexture2D(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new texture (connected to this compute shader) having the image information
member.param: The relative path to the image file (relative to the solution this code is in)
Determines whether the created texture can be shared, if true then CSTexture2D.Share() can be called

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateTexture2D(System.Int32,System.Int32,ComputeShaders.TextureFormat,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new texture (connected to this compute shader) having the data pointer information
member.param: The width of the texture
The height of the texture
the format of the texture
The pointer that holds raw texture data
Determines whether the created texture can be shared, if true then CSTexture2D.Share() can be called

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateTexture2DArray(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,ComputeShaders.TextureFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new texture connected to this compute shader (sharing the same Direct3D 11 device)
member.param: The width of the texture array
The height of the texture array
The number of texture in the texture array
the format of the texture array
Determines whether the created texture array can be shared, if true then CSTexture2DArray.Share() can be called

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateTexture2DArray(System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Bitmap[])
member.summary: Creates a new texture (connected to this compute shader) having the bitmaps information
member.param: Determines whether the created texture can be shared, if true then CSTexture2D.Share() can be called
The bitmaps (all with the same width, height, and format)

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateTexture2DArray(System.Int32,System.Int32,ComputeShaders.TextureFormat,System.Boolean,System.IntPtr[])
member.summary: Creates a new texture (connected to this compute shader) having the data pointer information
member.param: The width of the texture
The height of the texture
the format of the texture
Determines whether the created texture can be shared, if true then CSTexture2D.Share() can be called
The pointer that holds raw texture data

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateBuffer``1(``0,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new CSCBuffer (connected to this compute shader) that stores data
member.param: The data to be stored in the buffet. It must be a sturct.
The size of the data in bytes.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateStructuredBuffer``1(``0[],System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new StructuredBuffer (connected to this compute shader) that stores read/write data array. Be aware that the maximum size for a buffer is 25% of your Vram or 2gb, which is smaller, so the maximum number of elements is (maximum size / sizeof(T)).
member.param: The array to be stored in the buffer.
The size of an element in the array in bytes.
Determines whether the created texture can be shared, if true then Share() can be called.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateStructuredBuffer``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new StructuredBuffer (connected to this compute shader) that stores read/write data list Be aware that the maximum size for a buffer is 25% of your Vram or 2gb, which is smaller, so the maximum number of elements is (maximum size / sizeof(T)).
member.param: The list to be stored.
The size of an element in the list in bytes.
Determines whether the created texture can be shared, if true then Share() can be called.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.SetBuffer``1(ComputeShaders.CSCBuffer{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: connects the buffer to a cbuffer in the computeShader. This can be used once so there is no need to call this function every frame or every time you change something in the buffer.
member.param: The buffer to be set.
the register index of the buffer in the compute shader.
member.br: Example: cbuffer buffer : register(b0); its register index is 0

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.Dispatch(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Runs the compute shader
member.param: Number of threads in the x-axis
Number of threads in the y-axis
Number of threads in the z-axis

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CompileComputeShader(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compile the compute shader.
member.param: The path to the compute shader (relative to the solution this code is in)
The main kernel function of the shader (1 kernel function for every compute shader class)
The type and version of the shader. default = cs_5_0. (cs is for Compute shader) (5_0 is for shader model 5.0)
member.returns: Returns the byte code of the compiled shader

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CreateDevice(System.Int32,ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags)
member.summary: Creates a Direct3D 11 device

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the unmanneged data to prevent memory leaks. This function must be called after finishing using this.

member.name: T:ComputeShaders.CSCBuffer`1
member.summary: A class that stores data for cbuffer (in the compute shader)

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSCBuffer`1.UpdateBuffer(`0)
member.summary: Updates the buffer data
member.param: the new data

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSCBuffer`1.Share(ComputeShaders.ComputeShader)
member.summary: Connects this buffer to another compute shader so that data can read/write between the buffer and the compute shader or any buffer connected to it directly. NOTE: after calling this function if any changes occured to the buffer or the shared version then Flush() should be called on the changed buffer
member.param: The compute shader to connect with

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSCBuffer`1.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the unmanneged data to prevent memory leaks. This function must be called after finishing using this.

member.name: T:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1
member.summary: A class that stores an array of data for RWStructuredBuffer (in the compute shader)

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.CPU_Read
member.summary: The ability to read the buffer in the cpu

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.Length
member.summary: The number of elements in the buffer.

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.ElementSizeInBytes
member.summary: The size of each element in the buffer in bytes.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.SetData(`0[])
member.summary: Updates the data stored in the buffer
member.param: The new data

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.SetData(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0})
member.summary: Updates the data stored in the buffer
member.param: The new data

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.GetData(`0[]@)
member.summary: Copy the data in the buffer to the array
member.param: the array to copy to

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.GetData(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0}@)
member.summary: Copy the data in the buffer to the list. NOTE: it's prefered to use the GetData(ref T[] array) because using a list (this function) is alot slower
member.param: the list to copy to

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.EnableCPU_Read
member.summary:
Enables the ability to read the buffer using cpu. Enabling it has the advantages:
- to read the buffer raw data using GetData function.
and has the disadvantages:
- may decrease the performance.
- increase the memory usage to almost the double.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.DisablesCPU_Read
member.summary:
Disables the ability to read the buffer using cpu. Disables it has the advantages (if cpu read was enabled):
- may increase the performance.
- decrease the memory usage to almost the half.
and has the disadvantages:
- can not read the buffer raw data using GetData function.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.Share(ComputeShaders.ComputeShader)
member.summary: Connects this buffer to another compute shader so that data can read/write between the buffer and the compute shader or any buffer connected to it directly. NOTE: after calling this function if any changes occured to the buffer or the shared version then Flush() should be called on the changed buffer
member.param: The compute shader to connect with

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.Share``1(ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer{``0})
member.summary: Connects this buffer to another buffer so that data can read/write between the buffer and the other buffer or any buffer connected to it directly. NOTE: after calling this function if any changes occured to the buffer or the shared version then Flush() should be called on the changed buffer
member.param: The another buffer to connect with

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.Flush
member.summary: Sends queued-up commands in the command buffer to the graphics processing unit (GPU). It is used after updating a shared buffer

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the unmanneged data to prevent memory leaks. This function must be called after finishing using this.

member.name: T:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D
member.summary: The class that holds the texture data. This class can be created in ComputeShader class

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.Texture
member.summary: The SharpDX Direct3D 11 texture

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.CPU_ReadWrite
member.summary: The ability to read/write the texture in the cpu

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.Width
member.summary: The width of the texture

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.Height
member.summary: The height of the texture

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.Format
member.summary: The format of the texture

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.#ctor(System.IntPtr,ComputeShaders.TextureFormat)
member.summary: Create a new texture using a texture pointer
member.param: The texture pointer
The format of the texture

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.Share(ComputeShaders.ComputeShader)
member.summary: Connects this texture to another compute shader so that data can read/write between the texture and the compute shader or any texture connected to it directly. NOTE: after calling this function if any changes occured to the texture or the shared version then Flush() should be called on the changed texture
member.param: The compute shader to connect with

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.Share(ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D)
member.summary: Connects this texture to another texture so that data can read/write between the texture and the other texture or any texture connected to it directly. NOTE: after calling this function if any changes occured to the texture or the shared version then Flush() should be called on the changed texture
member.param: The another texture to connect with

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.Share(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Connects this texture to another texture so that data can read/write between the texture and the other texture or any texture connected to it directly. NOTE: after calling this function if any changes occured to the texture or the shared version then Flush() should be called on the changed texture
member.param: The another texture device to connect with

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.EnableCPU_ReadWrite
member.summary:
Enables the ability to read/write the texture using cpu. Enabling it has the advantages:
- to read the texture raw data using GetRawDataIntPtr function.
- to write to the texture raw data using WriteToRawData function.
and has the disadvantages:
- may decrease the performance.
- increase the memory usage to almost the double.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.DisablesCPU_ReadWrite
member.summary:
Disables the ability to read/write the texture using cpu. Disables it has the advantages (if cpu read/write was enabled):
- may increase the performance.
- decrease the memory usage to almost the half.
and has the disadvantages:
- can not read the texture raw data using GetRawDataIntPtr function.
- can not write to the texture raw data using WriteToRawData function.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.CopyToTexture(ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D)
member.summary: Copy the contents of the texture to another texture. NOTE: CPU read/write ability must be enabled for both textures, both textures must have exact same dimensions, and this function is so slow compared to using shared textures.
member.param: The texture to copy to.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.WriteToRawData(System.Action{ComputeShaders.TextureDataBox})
member.summary: Write to the texture raw data (using only cpu) by an write function. NOTE: the data box pointer is aligned to 16 bytes. Check: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/d3d11/ns-d3d11-d3d11_mapped_subresource

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.ReadFromRawData(System.Action{ComputeShaders.TextureDataBox})
member.summary: Reads through the raw data using 'readAction'. NOTE: all the reading process must ONLY be done inside 'readAction' function.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.Flush
member.summary: Sends queued-up commands in the command buffer to the graphics processing unit (GPU). It is used after updating a shared texture

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the unmanneged data to prevent memory leaks. This function must be called after finishing using the texture.

member.name: T:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray
member.summary: The class that holds the texture array data. This class can be created in ComputeShader class

member.summary: The SharpDX Direct3D 11 texture

member.summary: The width of the texture

member.summary: The number of textures in the texture array

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.Format
member.summary: The format of the texture

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.#ctor(System.IntPtr,ComputeShaders.TextureFormat)
member.summary: Create a new texture array using a texture array pointer
member.param: The texture array pointer
The format of the texture

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.Map(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the data contained in the texture array, and denies the GPU access to that texture. NOTE: after finishing using the pointer UnMap() must be called
member.param: whether you can read from that pointer
whether you can write to that pointer

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.MapSlice(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the data contained in a slice (texture) in the texture array, and denies the GPU access to that texture. NOTE: after finishing using the pointer UnMap() must be called
member.param: The index for the texture in the texture array
whether you can read from that pointer
whether you can write to that pointer

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.UnMap
member.summary: Invalidate the pointer to a resource and re-enable the GPU's access to that resource.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.Share(ComputeShaders.ComputeShader)
member.summary: Connects this texture array to another compute shader so that data can read/write between the texture array and the compute shader or any texture connected to it directly. NOTE: after calling this function if any changes occured to the texture array or the shared version then Flush() should be called on the changed texture array
member.param: The compute shader to connect with

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.Share(ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D)
member.summary: Connects this texture array to another texture so that data can read/write between the texture array and the other texture or any texture connected to it directly. NOTE: after calling this function if any changes occured to the texture array or the shared version then Flush() should be called on the changed texture array
member.param: The another texture to connect with

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.Flush
member.summary: Sends queued-up commands in the command buffer to the graphics processing unit (GPU). It is used after updating a shared texture

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the unmanneged data to prevent memory leaks. This function must be called after finishing using the texture.

member.summary: Dispose the unmanneged data to prevent memory leaks. This function must be called after finishing using this.
